1_15JNF8bdyG4zEWVASsgbkFirzM6gyYpSBA.body:
> [chinabiz](#comment_25_1DWrKbEomgBLHjczm1HkP556Vg68ewDmyd): Signal is good, very good, but it relies on GCM (Google Cloud Messaging network) for push delivery, which is mostly blocked in China, although you do receive messages via Signal, you don't usually receive the new message notifications, and that goes for any messaging app that relies on GCM, such as Surepsot.
> Whatsapp at the least use their own push network, as far as I can tell, my push notifications have never failed while in China. You don't have to get family to migrate, just use whatsapp as an alternative for more private stuff if you need to along side wechat, you can download the APK directly and sideload it onto an Android device, whatsapp will then update itself when needed.
> You can contact me on zeromail at chinabiz, or on bitmessage at BM-NBEzNpescY4BCsqpB9T8E8xsVLiw6zDq
